attributes.action: Allow up to 10 days term-time absence without fines – protect family rights.
attributes.additional_details: The current system unfairly penalises state school families, while parents of independent school pupils avoid fines. This creates a two-tier system and may breach ECHR rights to family life (Article 8) and non-discrimination (Article 14). Family time matters, and responsible parents should not be punished. The rules must be fair, lawful, and equally applied to all.
attributes.background: Allow parents to take up to 10 days of term-time absence per school year without penalty notices. Ensure consistent rules across all school types and review the system’s compliance with Articles 8 and 14 of the European Convention on Human Rights.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/727960
